page.title: 10TINTERN STATION
page.content: Tintern Station,situated between the main Chepstow to Monmouth road (A466) and the River Wye,about a quarter of a mile north of Tintern,is a reminder of the days of steam engines which ran between Chepstow and Monmouth,the old Wye Valley line.The line was single track the only passing place being at Tintern. Its present function is as a Wye Valley Railway museum where there are many photographs and artefacts,one of the most important being the token which had to be carried from one station to the next,its presence at a station showing the line was clear. The signal box has been preserved together with the signals.The waiting room and ticket office now display models of steam engines and provide a refreshment area and outside a picnic area.
